com.serialpundit.hid

Class SerialComHIDdevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.serialpundit.hid.SerialComHIDdevice

  • public final class SerialComHIDdevice
extends java.lang.Object

    Represents a HID device with information about it.

    Author:
    Rishi Gupta

    • Constructor Detail

      • SerialComHIDdevice

        public SerialComHIDdevice(java.lang.String transport,
                  java.lang.String deviceNode,
                  java.lang.String idVendor,
                  java.lang.String idProduct,
                  java.lang.String serial,
                  java.lang.String product,
                  java.lang.String manufacturer,
                  java.lang.String location)

        Construct and allocates a new SerialComHIDdevice object with given details.

        Parameters:
        transport - communication medium USB or Bluetooth this devices uses.
        deviceNode - identifier that can be used to open this device.
        idVendor - USB-IF unique vendor id of this device.
        idProduct - USB product id of this device.
        serial - serial number of this device.
        product - product identifier/description of this device.
        manufacturer - company manufacturing of this device.
        location - location in device tree created dynamically.
        Throws:
        com.serialpundit.core.SerialComException - if the object can not be constructed.

    • Method Detail

      • getTransportType

        public java.lang.String getTransportType()

        Returns USB or Bluetooth i.e. transport this device uses.

        Returns:
        USB or Bluetooth string whichever is applicable for this device.

      • getDeviceNode

        public java.lang.String getDeviceNode()

        Returns device node representing this device in system.

        In MAC os x, there is no device file for HID devices like '/dev/xxx'. Devices are identified by their usage or other properties. Therefore to maintain consistency, we create device node string with various properties separated by underscore : Transport_USB-VID_USB-PID_USB-serialnumber_LocationID

        Returns:
        string device node.

      • getVendorID

        public int getVendorID()

        Retrieves the vendor id of the USB device.

        Returns:
        vendor id of the USB device or -1 if location ID is not applicable for this platform.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the USB vendor id hex string can not be converted into numerical representation.

      • getProductID

        public int getProductID()

        Retrieves the product id of the USB device.

        Returns:
        product id of the USB device or -1 if location ID is not applicable for this platform.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the USB product id hex string can not be converted into numerical representation.

      • getSerialNumber

        public java.lang.String getSerialNumber()

        Retrieves the serial number string of the USB device.

        Returns:
        serial number string of the USB device.

        Returns:
